instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00928: What is 820-00928? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power button not working
threads.message: This board was pretty clean. After replacing a few components around UA900, it's booting normally but the power button is not working. Nothing happens when I hold it down. I tried another button. No change. Any ideas where to look for something like this? Everything around the power button is clean.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power button not working
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL> is open at the power button (<RESISTOR>R4911</RESISTOR>) but measures fine at <RESISTOR>R5170</RESISTOR>. A break somewhere in the line apparently.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power button not working
threads.message: Ok, just a blown trace. <RESISTOR>R5179</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5256</RESISTOR> are fine, but SW5200 is not connected to the line. Some damaged occurred at TPAC517 which seems to be the source of the problem. Need to figure out how to repair this line now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00928</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Power button not working
threads.message: Ran a wire halfway across the board. Working fine now.
